free: #e There was a person planting a tree, which bore six pears.
#c 有一個人他種了一棵樹，長出六顆梨子的樹。
#n pena(在IU 4)近似pina，而pina很有可能來自於ni-pa- "PFV-CAU-"的重組
#e He plucked pears.
#c 他去摘梨子。
#e He climbed up. The tree grew tall.
#c 他爬上去，那棵樹長得很大棵。
#e He climbed up. He climbed up with a ladder.
#c 他爬上去（的時候），用樓梯爬上去。
#e What he plucked were numerous.
#c 他摘的果實多了。
#e He went down to put (the pears) in the three baskets below.
#c 他下來了，要放置在下面的三個籃子。
#e Two baskets were full.
#c 兩個籃子都裝滿了。
#e He climbed up again to pluck (fruit) up there.
#c 他再次爬上去，在上面摘。
#e The tree was tall, and he climbed up.
#c 那棵樹很高，他爬到上面。
#e There was a person who pulled a goat along.
#c 有一個人牽著山羊。
#e He went and approached, seeing the plucked pears. He put them back.
#c 他靠近然後看了，（原來是）摘下來的梨子，就放了回去。
#e After a while, there was a child who rode a bike and passed by.
#c 一會兒，有一個小孩騎著單車，從那裡經過。
#e He saw a person plucking (fruit) above.
#c 他一看，那個人在上面摘（水果）。
#e He raised his head, and (saw) that person (the person who was plucking fruit) did not look down.
#c 他抬頭仰望，那個（摘果樹的）人都不往下看。
#e The child that rode a bike looked at the pears in the baskets.
#c 而後，騎著腳踏車的小孩，他看著在籃子裡的梨子。
#e He took one basket and put it on his bike.
#c 他拿走了一籃裝上他的腳踏車。
#e The person who climbed up did not see this.
#c 爬到上面的人沒有看到。
#e He couldn’t do anything. He was plucking (fruit) above.
#c 那有什麼辦法呢，（因為）他在上面摘嘛。
#n sa-maan-en:「有什麼辦法呢」(無奈的表示)；「用什麼方法」
#e The boy who rode a bike took one basket.
#c 那個騎單車的男孩拿走了一籃。
#e He rode his bike home.
#c 他就騎著單車回家。
#e Somewhere not far away, he met one girl who rode a bike.
#c 不遠處和他一位騎著腳踏車的女孩子交會了。
#n ra’ay:「遠」；tahira i ra’ay:「不遠」
#e When they met, the wind blew the boy’s hat away.
#c 他們交會的時候，忽然一陣風把那個男孩的帽子吹走了。
#n fiyuk來自於風聲
#e His hat fell.
#c 他的帽子掉下來。
#e His hat was going to fall down soon, so he grasped it.
#c 帽子就快要掉下來了，所以他扶住他的帽子。
#e Even though he tried hard, his hat still fell down.
#c 如此努力，帽子（還是）掉下來。
#e He could not look at the front attentively.
#c 他不能注意看著前方。
#e There was a stone in the front, and the bike hit the stone.
#c 前面有一塊石頭，腳踏車撞上那顆石頭。
#e The child fell down.
#c 那個小孩突然跌倒。
#e His foot hurt.
#c 他的腳很痛。
#e The pears in the basket were scattered all over when he fell down.
#c 在他摔倒的時候，籃子裡的梨子全部傾倒散落滿地。
#e He stroked his foot.
#c 他撫摸他的腳。
#e The child could not get up.
#c 那小孩無法爬起身來。
#e After a while, there were three children who were as old as he. The three approached him.
#c 沒多久，有三個跟他一樣大的小孩，那三個人靠近他。
#e The three children passed the person who plucked fruit and they carried balls.
#c 那三個小孩將經過摘水果的，他們拿著球。
#e He helped pick up the pears and put them in the basket.
#c 他幫忙撿梨子，裝在籃子裡。
#e The child who fell down got up.
#c 那個跌倒的小孩起來了。
#e The three helped him put (the pears) onto his bike.
#c 那三個人協助他放到他的腳踏車上。
#e Then, the child left and went home.
#c 之後，那個小孩就離開回家了。
#e The three went towards their destination.
#c 那三個人呢，要去他們的目的地。
#e They went past the road where the person was plucking pears.
#c 經過那條路，那個人在摘梨子的那一條路。
#e The person who was plucking pears went down.
#c 摘水果的人下來。
#e He saw only one basket was filled with pears, and one basket was not full.
#c 他看，只有一個籃子裝滿梨子，一個籃子沒有裝。
#e Where was one basket? He kept thinking.
#c 一個籃子到哪去了呢？他不斷的想。
#e He found the three people who passed nothing (special).
#c 路過的那三個人，他一看，沒有什麼（特別的）。
#e They passed, carrying balls.
#c 他們三個（只）拿著球經過。
#e That person shook his head. His head was lopsided, looking at the basket which not was filled with pears.
#c 那個人搖頭，歪著頭，看著沒有裝梨子的籃子。
